newsitem.title: USA: Hyperion in Baan pact, sees June qtr charge.
newsitem.headline: Hyperion in Baan pact, sees June qtr charge.

text.p: Hyperion Software said it signed a letter of intent with Baan Co NV to form a joint venture and sales channel strategy and that it will take a financial charge in the June quarter as a result.

Hyperion said it expected to take non-recurring charges in its fourth fiscal quarter ending in June of about $4 million, or $2.5 million after-tax, cutting earnings by $0.13 per share for asset valuation and restructuring costs for the Baan deal.
The First Call consensus expectation for Hyperion's June quarter was $0.54 per share prior to the Baan announcement.

The company said the deal would include joint development of future accounting products, based on Baan's expertise in complex transactional Enterprise Resource Planning software and Hyperion's financial and information management products.
Hyperion disclosed the upcoming charge in its earnings release for the fiscal third quarter ended March 31.

Hyperion reported earnings per share of $0.07 per share in the latest quarter, which compares to the $0.06 First Call consensus projection for the period and the $0.02 per share reported in the March quarter a year ago.
Hyperion stock was off 2 at 15-5/8 at 1100 EDT. Shares of Amsterdam-based Baan were up 2 at 46-7/8 in Nasdaq trading. (( -- Eric Auchard, New York newsdesk, 212-859-1736))
